page.title: 19SHEEP FARMING IN WAPPENBURY
page.content: All the farm workers live in small cottages.The farmer sells his barley and wheat.He saves 20 tons of barley which just lasts the sheep through winter time.He has 486 acres.He employs 7 people who live near the farm.Just over 200 lambs were born in 1985.He grows grass,hay,barley,wheat and all for food.He keeps{Suffolk sheep.He has 400 tons of silage.He is not thinking of making any changes for the future.Mr Robinson has these sheep because they are most popular with other farmers.He produces Â£1500 worth of wool,but he makes most money by selling his{champion ewes and lambs to other farmers.He takes most of his champion sheep to the{ROYAL SHOW}every year.He gets a rosette for his sheep. He has lots of champion sheep and he gets lots of money.
